concept.title: Unmatching Record Handling
concept.shortdesc: When a record does not match any condition, the Stream Selector can use the error handling for unmatched records or you can configure a default stream that accepts the unmatched records:

dlentry.dd:
Stream Selector processorunmatched record handlingunmatched record handlingStream SelectorThe Unmatched Record Handling property determines how the Stream Selector handles records that do not match any conditions. The Stream Selector can perform one of the following actions:
Discard the record.
Send the error to the pipeline for error handling.
Stop the pipeline.
You can create a default stream to capture records that do not match other conditions. When you create a default stream, you connect the output to a branch in the pipeline.
You can configure the branch to perform additional processing or write it directly to a destination. You might write the data to a real destination or use the Trash destination.

The Stream Selector passes deleted tweets to the Deleted Tweets destination. It routes new tweets with possibly sensitive language to a Field Masker to mask the potentially inappropriate text, and passes all remaining tweets directly to the New Tweets destination.
